subSubSection.paragraph: Holotype ♂, [Iran], "S-Iran, Strasse Shiraz-Kazerun, Imam Sade, 1200 m, 3.vi.1969, H.G. Amsel leg." | "gen. slide 47/18, O. Bidzilya" (SMNK); Paratypes: 3 ♂, 4 ♀, same data as holotype (gen. slide 1/18♂, 77/18♀, O. Bidzilya); 1 ♂, S-Iran, 4-7.vi.1969, Miyan Katal, 1900 m, oestl . Kazerun, 51°40 'oeL , 29°30'nB (Amsel) (all SMNK)

The new species is defined externally by the forewing narrowed in distal half and less extensive black pattern contrary to the other blackish-white
Tricerophora
-species.
T. brumale
sp. n. is more strongly black-irrorated and the forewings are not narrowed in distal half. The apically acute valva with merged sacculus and broad sub-triangular saccus are characteristic for the male genitalia. The female genitalia are distinct by sternum VIII broadly sclerotized laterally in combination with long and broad ductus bursae which is sclerotized in distal half only.
The specific name is derived from Latin "acutus" - sharp, and "valva" - clasper, referring the apically pointed valva of the new species.
Adults have been collected in early June.
